act_info.full_title: Supplementary Interim Appropriation for 2020-2021 Act, 2020, S.O. 2020, c. 36, Sched. 42

content.content: 1 Expressions used in this Act have the same meaning as in the Financial Administration Act unless the context requires otherwise.
content.raw_html: 1 Expressions used in this Act have the same meaning as in the Financial Administration Act unless the context requires otherwise.

content.section: Additional amounts to be paid or recognized
content.content: 2 All amounts authorized under sections 3 and 4 to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments are in addition to the amounts authorized to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments under sections 2 and 3 of the Interim Appropriation for 2020-2021 Act, 2019.
content.raw_html: 2 All amounts authorized under sections 3 and 4 to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments are in addition to the amounts authorized to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments under sections 2 and 3 of the Interim Appropriation for 2020-2021 Act, 2019.

content.content: 3 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2021, amounts not exceeding a total of $23,389,964,800 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses to be applied to the expenses of the public service that are not otherwise provided for.
content.raw_html: 3 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2021, amounts not exceeding a total of $23,389,964,800 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses to be applied to the expenses of the public service that are not otherwise provided for.

content.content: 4 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2021, amounts not exceeding a total of $208,404,200 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash investments to be applied to the investments of the public service in capital assets, loans and other investments that are not otherwise provided for.
content.raw_html: 4 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2021, amounts not exceeding a total of $208,404,200 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash investments to be applied to the investments of the public service in capital assets, loans and other investments that are not otherwise provided for.

content.content:
5 All expenditures made or recognized under this Act must be charged to the proper appropriation following the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2021. 6 Omitted
(provides for coming into force of provisions of this Act). 7 Omitted (enacts short title of this Act). ______________  Français
content.raw_html:
5 All expenditures made or recognized under this Act must be charged to the proper appropriation following the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2021.

6 Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Act).

7 Omitted (enacts short title of this Act).
